Ducks players prepare for an incoming serve from the Colorado Buffaloes PERIOD Oregon Ducks womens volleyball takes on the Colorado Buffaloes at Matthew Knight Arena in Eugene Ore. on Feb   PERIOD Ian EngerEmerald

The Oregon volleyball team faced the Colorado Buffaloes in the first game of their series on Friday afternoon in Matthew Knight Arena PERIOD The Ducks won with a final score of  PERIOD

Colorado looked to rebound against the Ducks after suffering four straight losses to both Washington State and Washington PERIOD The Buffs were off to a  start but now have fallen to  on the year PERIOD

The No PERIOD  ranked Ducks however entered Fridays match on a fivegame win streak since their loss to UCLA on Jan PERIOD  PERIOD With Fridays win Oregon extended their streak to six making it the longest since the  season PERIOD

Oregons strength this year has been their defense PERIOD The Ducks currently have junior Brooke Nuneviller senior Taylor Borup and sophomore Georgia Murphy averaging over . digs a game PERIOD

In the first set the Ducks held Colorado to a . hitting percentage while Oregon maintained a . hitting percentage PERIOD

Sophomores Taylor Williams and Murphy combined for  digs along with seven kills from sophomore Karson Bacon in the first set the Ducks held their lead for the entire match PERIOD

The second set looked different for Colorado as they increased their hitting percentage to . in the beginning PERIOD Early in the score was  PERIOD But Colorado quickly lost their lead as the Ducks mounted a comeback tying the game at  PERIOD

From that point forward the match was back and forth with the highest lead being by a point PERIOD At one point Gloria Mutiri and Williams almost collided going for a dig showing the miscommunication PERIOD Errors from serves were apparent on both sides as the second set was much grittier than the first PERIOD

Finally the Ducks took the set with a score of  ending it with a  scoring run PERIOD

The third and final set was all Oregon as the Ducks dominated right from the start never losing their lead as they capitalized on errors from their opponent PERIOD The Ducks defense held Colorado again to a . hitting percentage PERIOD They finished the third set  PERIOD

In Oregons impressive  sweep several Ducks turned in solid performances from sophomore Abby Hansen who led with  kills and Junior Brooke Nuneviller who played a versatile game with  kills and  digs PERIOD

The  Ducks face the Buffaloes again this Sunday Feb PERIOD  in Matthew Knight at  a.m PERIOD
